metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12401 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Some special resource URIs will cause a non-exploitable crash if loadedwith optional parameters following a '?' in the parsed string. This couldlead to denial of service (DOS) attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox< 63.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12401` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
